intro: Diphyllocalyx cayensis subsp. variifolius, commonly known as the Cayenne trumpetflower, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly in parts of Guyana and Venezuela. The plant is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically bright red or orange. Its leaves are variable in shape, giving rise to its subspecies name *variifolius*. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in lowland rainforests.
